description: From Urdu صراف‎ (sarrāf) and Persian صراف‎ (sarâf), from Arabic صَرَّاف‎ (ṣarrāf).

entries.meaning: A provider of financial services in the Middle East and in South Asia, especially (historical) during the early modern and colonial period.
examples: There is in euery place of the street exchangers of mony, by them called Xaraffos, which are all christian Iewes.
